This is probably the worst voice chat platform the world has ever seen. The UI looks awful and the usability and performance is too. For what it does it consumes way too much RAM and CPU. audio quality also is not nearly as good as with TeamSpeak or Mumble.
On top of that, your account often gets suspended, banned or locked when you travel and log on from different locations every now and then. Their support, if you can call it that, is either not responding or not helpful at all. Abysmal, arrogant and dismissive. How this garbage could become the most popular among gamers is baffling.
Thanks, but no thanks

Don't install the flathub version of this. 
1. Lots of sandbox issues. Drag and drop for images and attachment is broken by default. Game detection broken.
2. Frequent breaks due to library issues. See this for the most recent example:

If you want Discord grab a native version, Flatpak isn't ready.

description: Great app, would recommend

Discord is the de facto communications app for the online gaming world, and it's not hard to see why. At no cost, you can create communities, run bots in those communities to add functionality or even games, create voice chat rooms, do video conferences, and join as many other groups as you'd like. There are just SO MANY communities out there, and it's super easy to use. The premium stuff you have to pay for actually feels like a premium, rather than basic functionality gated off behind a paywall. There are ads, but they're only on the main screen and they're well integrated so as to be unobtrusive.

The UI is a bit rough around the edges, and because of the formatting of the window, it can be difficult to find the settings you're looking for until you're used to it, but with practice it's a great tool. I do rather wish they had better privacy practices. THey're not terrible, but it's not great, and the app and protocol are both closed source, which makes me uncomfortable as well. Still, four stars, guys.
summary: It's great, I just wish there was more respect for privacy

There are no Flatseal options which prevent it from accessing your X11 windowing system while also remaining functional. It can see everything you can see, including passwords, private communications, titles headings text, etc.

You NEED to run this in a virtual machine instead of relying on Flatpak with minimal functional permissions. Flatpak does not inform you or ask you each time these resources are accessed. Its the same idea as letting grifters live in your house alone and expect them not to steal anything or trash the place.
summary: Works great, but Flatpak doesn't make it secure

La qualité du micro peut varier au démarrage. Une déconnexion/reconnexion du micro peut aider. Le glisser-déposer de fichiers extérieurs n'est pas fonctionnel. L'accès à certains dossiers depuis l'application est bloqué à cause du confinement de celle-ci. Les jeux en cours ne sont pas détectés (toujours à cause du confinement de Flatpak). À part ça le reste marche bien.

1°) Les jeux ne sont pas détectés.
2°) L'appuyer pour parler fonctionne mal
3°) Le thème est mal intégré
4°) L'application consomme un peu plus qu'en natif sur Fedora ou Arch/Manjaro
5°) Les notifications fonctionnent parfois, mais pas en permanence
Discord pour linux
unstable flatpak 0.0.10 version with Fedora
Every functionnality is there and working properly, however, the app silently crashes fairly often (sometimes up to 5 times per hour) on my install.

Encore un simple navigateur déguisé sur base de Chrome qui n'apporte rien par rapport à l'interface web. Pire, l'application plante de temps à autre, en moins d'une heure d'utilisation. Brancher une manette PS4 fera passer le son du micro, sans changer sa source, au maximum, systématiquement, ce qui est très désagréable pour les autres. Aucune intégration au système, pas d'intégration au menu du son que çà soit sous Gnome ou KDE.

Bref, aucun intérêt à part faire croire que Discord supporte GNU/Linux via une appli dédiée quand çà n'est pas le cas.
summary: Inutile, passez par le site web
